# 3 Prepare public objects
## 3.1 Prepare ensembl v98 database
```{r}
ah <- AnnotationHub(cache="/group/canc2/anson/.cache/R/AnnotationHub", ask=FALSE)
EnsDb.Hsapiens.v98 <- query(ah, c("EnsDb", "Homo Sapiens", 98))[[1]]
```

## 3.2 Wendisch et al. dataset
```{r}
# load object
seu.wendisch <- qread(here("data","public_datasets","wendisch","SCEs","wendisch.SEU.qs"),nthreads=16)

wendisch.celltype <- c("Monocytes","Mono/Mφ","CD163/LGMN-Mφ")
# select columns from metadata
metadata <- seu.wendisch@meta.data %>%
  dplyr::mutate(orig.ident="Wendisch") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(batchID="Wendisch") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(condition="Covid") %>%
  dplyr::select(orig.ident, nCount_RNA, nFeature_RNA, age, sex,
                batchID, Cluster, condition, patient)
colnames(metadata)
colnames(metadata) <- c("orig.ident","nCount_RNA","nFeature_RNA","age","sex",
                        "batchID","orig.celltype","condition","sample")
metadata$orig.ident <- "Wendisch"

# match gene ID
ensdb_columns <- setNames(c("GENEBIOTYPE", "SEQNAME","SYMBOL"),
                          paste0("ENSEMBL.",
                                 c("GENEBIOTYPE", "SEQNAME","SYMBOL")))
stopifnot(all(ensdb_columns %in% columns(EnsDb.Hsapiens.v98)))

ensdb_df <- DataFrame(
  lapply(ensdb_columns, function(column) {
    mapIds(
      x = EnsDb.Hsapiens.v98,
      keys = rownames(seu.wendisch@assays$RNA@counts),
      keytype = "GENEID",
      column = column,
      multiVals = "first")
  }),
  row.names = rownames(seu.wendisch@assays$RNA@counts))

# make feature names unique
counts <- seu.wendisch@assays$RNA@counts
rownames(counts) <- uniquifyFeatureNames(rownames(ensdb_df), ensdb_df$ENSEMBL.SYMBOL)

# Create new object
seu.wendisch.backup <- seu.wendisch
seu.wendisch <- CreateSeuratObject(counts, meta.data = metadata)
seu.wendisch <- subset(seu.wendisch, orig.celltype %in% wendisch.celltype)

```

## 3.3 Li et al. dataset
```{r}

colnames(metadata)

stopifnot(all(ensdb_columns %in% columns(EnsDb.Hsapiens.v98)))

ensdb_df <- DataFrame(
  lapply(ensdb_columns, function(column) {
    mapIds(
      x = EnsDb.Hsapiens.v98,
      keys = rownames(seu.li@assays$RNA@counts),
      keytype = "SYMBOL",
      column = column,
      multiVals = "first")
```

# 6 Analysis
## 6.1 Gene set module score
Gene sets from 4 studies were selected:
- Li et al. 2022 [CF]
- Wendisch et al. 2021 [COVID-19]
- Liao et al. 2020 [COVID-19]
- Morrell et al. 2023 [AHRF]

### 6.1.1 Prepare gene sets
```{r}
# Present
present.markers <- read.csv(here("data","RecM.markers.csv"))[,"MDM.PLA2G7hi"]

# Li et al. 2022 [CF]
li.markers <- read_excel(here("data","public_datasets","li","inline-supplementary-material-2.xls"))
head(li.markers)

li.genesets <- 
  li.markers %>%
  dplyr::filter(cluster=="SPP1.IMs") %>%
  dplyr::select(gene) %>% unlist(use.names = FALSE)

# Wendisch et al. 2021 [Covid]
wendisch.genesets <- c("MARCKS","CD84","RAP2B","TMEM37","OLFML2B",
                       "MERTK","TTYH3","GPNMB","LGMN","RGL1",
                       "BLVRB","CTSB","NPL","TPCN1","CMKLR1",
                       "CD163","ABCA1","MAF","FPR3","PSAP",
                       "A2M","MPP1","GALM","LHFPL2","PLTP",
                       "BCAT1","SDC3","RNASE1","SLC36A1","FNIP2",
                       "PLXNC1","PMP22","RNF130","ETV5","MFSD1",
                       "MS4A6A","SDS","MAFB","CREG1","ADAM9",
                       "LIPA","BASP1","CPM","PLA2G7","AP2A2",
                       "ADAP2","CTSL","IL10","ADORA3","HM13")

# Liao et al. 2020 [Covid]
liao.markers <- read_excel(here("data","public_datasets","liao","Liao_tableS5.xlsx"))
head(liao.markers)

liao.genesets <-
  liao.markers %>%
  dplyr::filter(cluster=="Group3") %>%
  dplyr::select(gene) %>% unlist(use.names = FALSE)

# Morrell et al. 2023
morrell.markers <- read_excel(here("data","public_datasets","morrell","Morrell_tableS5.xlsx"))

morrell.genesets <- 
  morrell.markers %>%

  dplyr::select(Cluster.0, Cluster.6) %>% unlist(use.names = FALSE)
```

```{r fig.width=15, fig.height=6}
p1
```

### 6.1.3 One-sided wilcoxon test
```{r}
seu_md <- seu.orig@meta.data
clusters <- paste0("Cluster", 1:5)

# Define mapping for cluster → Reference label
ref_labels <- c(
  "Cluster1" = "Present",
  "Cluster2" = "Li",
  "Cluster3" = "Wendisch",
  "Cluster4" = "Liao",
  "Cluster5" = "Morrell"
)

tests <- map_dfr(clusters, function(cl) {
  seu_md %>%
    wilcox_test(
      reformulate("subtype", response = cl),
      ref.group = "all",
      alternative = "less",
      exact = TRUE,
      p.adjust.method = "BH",
      detailed = TRUE
    ) %>%
    mutate(
      Reference = ref_labels[[cl]],
      `-log10_p` = ifelse(
        is.infinite(-log10(p)),
        ">300",
        as.character(-log10(p))
      ),
      `-log10_p.adj` = ifelse(
        is.infinite(-log10(p.adj)),
        ">300",
        as.character(-log10(p.adj))
      )
    )
})
tests %>% as.data.frame() %>% write.csv(file=here("data","Fig3A.stat.csv"))

df <- split(seu.orig@meta.data, seu.orig$subtype)

# Present
stat.test1 <- seu.orig@meta.data %>%
  wilcox_test(Cluster1 ~ subtype,
              ref.group = "all",
              alternative="less",
              exact=TRUE,
              p.adjust.method = "BH",
              detailed = TRUE)

-log10(stat.test1$p.adj)

# Li
stat.test2 <- seu.orig@meta.data %>%
  wilcox_test(Cluster2 ~ subtype,
              ref.group = "all",
              alternative="less",
              exact=TRUE,
              p.adjust.method = "BH",
              detailed = TRUE)

-log10(stat.test2$p.adj)

# Wendisch
stat.test3 <- seu.orig@meta.data %>%
  wilcox_test(Cluster3 ~ subtype,
              ref.group = "all",
              alternative="less",
              exact=TRUE,
              p.adjust.method = "BH",
              detailed = TRUE)

-log10(stat.test3$p.adj)

# Liao
stat.test4 <- seu.orig@meta.data %>%
  wilcox_test(Cluster4 ~ subtype,
              ref.group = "all",
              alternative="less",
              exact=TRUE,
              p.adjust.method = "BH",
              detailed = TRUE)

-log10(stat.test4$p.adj)

# Morrell
stat.test5 <- seu.orig@meta.data %>%
  wilcox_test(Cluster5 ~ subtype,
              ref.group = "all",
              alternative="less",
              exact=TRUE,
              p.adjust.method = "BH",
              detailed = TRUE)

-log10(stat.test5$p.adj)

write.csv(stat.test1 %>% data.frame(), file=here("data","Present.stat.csv"))
write.csv(stat.test2 %>% data.frame(), file=here("data","Li.stat.csv"))
write.csv(stat.test3 %>% data.frame(), file=here("data","Wendisch.stat.csv"))
write.csv(stat.test4 %>% data.frame(), file=here("data","Liao.stat.csv"))
write.csv(stat.test5 %>% data.frame(), file=here("data","Morrell.stat.csv"))

# write statistics
setDT(seu.orig@meta.data)
seu.orig@meta.data[, as.list(summary(dt)), by = subtype]

tapply(seu.orig@meta.data$Cluster1, seu.orig@meta.data$subtype,summary) %>% data.frame() %>% apply(2,as.character) %>% write.csv(file=here("data","Fig3A.stat.csv"))

# write summary
# Start from meta
md <- as.data.table(seu.orig@meta.data)

# 1) Create a canonical group2 column
if (!"group2" %in% names(md)) {
  if ("Condition2" %in% names(md)) {
    md[, group2 := as.character(Condition2)]
  } else if ("subtype" %in% names(md)) {
    md[, group2 := as.character(subtype)]
  } else {
    stop("No grouping column found: expected one of group2 / Condition2 / subtype.")
  }
}
md[, group2 := trimws(group2)]

# 2) Reference mapping
ref_labels <- c(
  "Cluster1" = "Present",
  "Cluster2" = "Li",
  "Cluster3" = "Wendisch",
  "Cluster4" = "Liao",
  "Cluster5" = "Morrell"
)
cols <- paste0("Cluster", 1:5)

# 3) Long → add Reference → drop cluster → summary by (Reference, group2)
summ_dt <- melt(
  md,
  id.vars = "group2",
  measure.vars = cols,
  variable.name = "cluster",
  value.name = "value"
)[, `:=`(
  Reference = ref_labels[cluster]
)][, c("cluster") := NULL
][, as.list(summary(value)), by = .(Reference, group2)]

# 4) Order: Reference then group2 (CFN, CFB, C)
ref_order   <- c("Present", "Li", "Wendisch", "Liao", "Morrell")
group_order <- c("CFN", "CFB", "C")

summ_dt[, Reference := factor(Reference, levels = ref_order)]
summ_dt[, group2    := factor(group2,    levels = group_order)]
setorder(summ_dt, Reference, group2)

# 5) Write out as Fig3A.stat.csv
fwrite(summ_dt, here::here("data", "Fig3A_summary.csv"))

```

```{r}
# meta as data.table
md <- as.data.table(seu.orig@meta.data)

# RecM subset column (use the one you used in wilcox: 'subtype')
if (!"subtype" %in% names(md)) stop("Expected column 'subtype' not found for RecM subset.")

# Map cluster → Reference labels
ref_labels <- c(
  "Cluster1" = "Present",
  "Cluster2" = "Li",
  "Cluster3" = "Wendisch",
  "Cluster4" = "Liao",
  "Cluster5" = "Morrell"
)

# clusters to include
clusters <- paste0("Cluster", 1:5)

# desired output orders
ref_order    <- c("Present", "Li", "Wendisch", "Liao", "Morrell")
subset_order <- c("Mono","MDM-IV","MDM-FABP4lo","MDM-FABP4hi","MDM-inflam","MDM-PLA2G7hi","IM")

## --- 1) Per-(Reference × RecM subset) summaries -------------------------

# Long table of all cluster values, tagged with Reference
long_dt <- melt(
  md,
  id.vars = "subtype",
  measure.vars = clusters,
  variable.name = "cluster",
  value.name = "value"
)[, `:=`(Reference = ref_labels[cluster])][, cluster := NULL][]

# Summaries (Min, 1st Qu., Median, Mean, 3rd Qu., Max) by Reference × subset
summ_dt <- long_dt[
  , as.list(summary(value)), by = .(Reference, subtype)
]

# Rename to match your exact headers
setnames(
  summ_dt,
  old = c("subtype", "Min.", "1st Qu.", "Median", "Mean", "3rd Qu.", "Max."),
  new = c("RecM subset", "Min", "1st Quatile", "Median", "Mean", "3rd Quatile", "Max value")
)

## --- 2) Wilcoxon tests per cluster (Reference) vs 'all' by subtype ------

seu_md <- seu.orig@meta.data  # tibble/data.frame for rstatix

tests <- map_dfr(clusters, function(cl) {
  seu_md %>%
    wilcox_test(
      reformulate("subtype", response = cl),
      ref.group = "all",
      alternative = "less",
      exact = TRUE,
      p.adjust.method = "BH",
      detailed = TRUE
    ) %>%
    mutate(
      Reference = ref_labels[[cl]],
      `-log10(p)` = ifelse(is.infinite(-log10(p)), ">300", as.character(-log10(p))),
      `-log10(p.adj)` = ifelse(is.infinite(-log10(p.adj)), ">300", as.character(-log10(p.adj)))
    ) %>%
    dplyr::select(Reference, `RecM subset` = group2, `-log10(p)`, `-log10(p.adj)`)
})

## --- 3) Join summaries + p-values, order, and write ---------------------

out <- as.data.table(summ_dt)[
  as.data.table(tests),
  on = .(Reference, `RecM subset`)
]

# Order rows
out[, Reference := factor(Reference, levels = ref_order)]
out[, `RecM subset` := factor(`RecM subset`, levels = subset_order)]
setorder(out, Reference, `RecM subset`)

# Select and order columns exactly as requested
out <- out[, .(
  Reference,
  `RecM subset`,
  Min,
  `1st Quatile`,
  Median,
  `3rd Quatile`,
  `Max value`,
  Mean,
  `-log10(p)`,
  `-log10(p.adj)`
)]

# Write CSV
fwrite(out, here("data", "RecM_summary_with_p.csv"))

```

## 6.3 UMAP embeddings
### 6.3.1 Grouped by datasets

### 6.3.3 Profibrotic cell type density
```{r fig.height=3, fig.width=9}
seu$Harmony.UMAP1 <- seu@reductions$umap@cell.embeddings[,1]
seu$Harmony.UMAP2 <- seu@reductions$umap@cell.embeddings[,2]
seu$CellID <- rownames(seu@meta.data)

get_density <- function(x, y, ...) {
  dens <- MASS::kde2d(x, y, ...)
  ix <- findInterval(x, dens$x)
  iy <- findInterval(y, dens$y)
  ii <- cbind(ix, iy)
  return(dens$z[ii])
}

dens.umap.list <- list()
loop.cells <- levels(seu$orig.celltype)

for(i in seq_along(loop.cells)){
    i.c <- loop.cells[i]
    # change this to 1% of all cells
    i.n <- ceiling(sum(seu$orig.celltype %in% i.c)/100)
    if(i.n < 100){
      i.n <- 100
    }
    i.dens <- get_density(seu$Harmony.UMAP1[seu$orig.celltype %in% i.c],
                          seu$Harmony.UMAP2[seu$orig.celltype %in% i.c], n=i.n)
    
    dens.umap.list[[i.c]] <- data.frame("orig.celltype"=i.c,
                                        "CellID"=seu$CellID[seu$orig.celltype %in% i.c],
                                        "Dens"=i.dens)
}

umap.dens <- do.call(rbind.data.frame, dens.umap.list)
umap.dens.merge <- base::merge(seu@meta.data, umap.dens, by=c('orig.celltype', 'CellID'))


cell.order <- c("MDM-PLA2G7high","SPP1.IMs","CD163/LGMN-Mφ")
title.list <- setNames(c(expression('MDM-'*italic('PLA2G7')^'high'),
                         expression(italic('SPP1')*".IMs"),
                         expression(italic("CD163")*"/"*italic("LGMN")*"-Mφ")),
                       cell.order)
pt.list <- list()
for(x in seq_along(cell.order)){
  x.c <- cell.order[x]
  
  p <- ggplot(umap.dens.merge,
         aes(x=Harmony.UMAP1, y=Harmony.UMAP2)) +
    geom_scattermore(data=umap.dens.merge[, c("Harmony.UMAP1", "Harmony.UMAP2")],
                     colour='#adb5bd',) +
    geom_point_rast(data=umap.dens.merge[umap.dens.merge$orig.celltype %in% x.c, ],
                    aes(colour=Dens), size=0.001) +
    scale_colour_viridis() +
    labs(title=title.list[x.c], x="UMAP1", y="UMAP2") +
    theme_cowplot() +
    guides(colour=guide_colourbar(title="Density")) +
    theme(plot.title=element_text(size=8,hjust=0.5,face="plain"),
          legend.key.size = unit(0.2, "cm"),
          axis.text=element_blank(),
          axis.title=element_blank(),
          axis.line = element_blank(),
          axis.ticks=element_blank(),
          legend.title=element_text(size=6),
          legend.text=element_blank())
    pt.list[[x.c]] <- p
}


p4 <- pt.list[[1]] + pt.list[[2]] + pt.list[[3]]
p4
```
